definitions.definition: establish the truth or correctness of (something previously believed, suspected, or feared to be the case).
examples: if these fears are confirmed, the outlook for the economy will be dire

definitions.definition: state with assurance that a report or fact is true.
examples: he confirmed that the general was in the hands of the rebels
synonyms: guarantee "he confirmed that help was on the way"

definitions.definition: reinforce someone in (an opinion, belief, or feeling).
examples: he fueled his misogyny by cultivating women who confirmed him in this view
synonyms: back up "records confirm the latest evidence"

definitions.definition: make (a provisional arrangement or appointment) definite.
examples: Mr. Baker's assistant telephoned to confirm his appointment with the chairman

definitions.definition: make (something, especially a person's appointment to a position or an agreement) formally valid; ratify.
examples: the organization has confirmed the appointment of Mr. Collins as managing director
synonyms: accept "his appointment was confirmed by the president"

definitions.definition: formally declare (someone) to be appointed to a particular position.
examples: he was confirmed as the new peace envoy

definitions.definition: administer the religious rite of confirmation to.
examples: he had been baptized and confirmed
